content:
Paul runs track, and he is training to improve his time in the $400$-meter race.  He does a time trial every $10$ days to monitor his improvement.  He's used the line $y = -1.5x + 115$ to model his $400$-meter time as a function of the number of days he has trained.  The table below shows the residuals generated by this model.  

**In the table below, calculate the data values for each point.  Then plot the data on the graph below.**  

**Would an exponential or quadratic model be a better fit for the data?**  [[☃ dropdown 1]]  

 | | | || ||
- | - | -
**Number of days** | $0$|$10$ | $20$| $30$ | $40$ | $50$
**Residual value** | $5$ | $-10$| $-10$ | $-5$|$5$|$20$  
**Time (seconds)** | [[☃ input-number 1]] | [[☃ input-number 2]]|  [[☃ input-number 3]]| [[☃ input-number 4]]|[[☃ input-number 5]]|[[☃ input-number 6]] 

[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]
